# CSVReadingError.unsupportedEncoding(_:)

**Case**

An error that indicates the CSV reader doesn’t support an encoding.

## Declaration

```swift
case unsupportedEncoding(String)
```

## Discussion

The associated value contains a description of the error.

## Getting Error Information

- **column**: The index of the column that contains the error.
- **row**: The index of the row that contains the error.
- **CSVReadingError.badEncoding(row:column:cellContents:)**: An error that indicates CSV data contains an invalid UTF-8 byte sequence.
- **CSVReadingError.failedToParse(row:column:type:cellContents:)**: An error that indicates the CSV reader can’t parse data in the file.
- **CSVReadingError.misplacedQuote(row:column:)**: An error that indicates the CSV data contains a misplaced quote.
- **CSVReadingError.missingColumn(columnName:)**: An error that indicates the CSV is missing a required column.
- **CSVReadingError.wrongNumberOfColumns(row:columns:expected:)**: An error that indicates the CSV data contains a row with a mismatched number of columns.

items.description: The index of the column that contains the error.
